description: Jogging is a cardiovascular exercise that involves running at a steady and moderate pace
results: Improves cardiovascular endurance, boosts metabolism, burns calories, strengthens leg muscles, and enhance mood and mental well-being

description: Push-ups are a bodyweight exercise that involves lowering your body to the ground and pushing back up using your arms
results: Improves posture, builds muscle mass, and enhances overall upper-body stability and coordination
reps: 3 sets of 10-15 repetitions with a short rest between sets

description: Yoga combines physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation. Focuses on the mind-body connection
results: Increases flexibility, improves muscle tone and strength, reduces stress and anxiety, enhances mindfulness, and promotes a sense of inner calm
reps: Hold each pose for 30 seconds to a minute or more

description: The plank is an isometric core exercise that involves holding a position similar to the top of a push-up. It engages the core muscles, including the abs and lower back
results: Strengthens and enhances the core muscles, improves stability and balance, reduces back pain, and enhance overall core strength for better posture
reps: Starting with 20-30 seconds and gradually increasing the time

description: Riding a bicycle outdoors or on a stationary bike. It is a low-impact cardiovascular exercise that targets the legs and promotes aerobic fitness
results: Improves cardiovascular health, tones leg muscles, burn calories, and boosts mood

description: Stretching involves gently lengthening and elongating the muscles to improve flexibility and range of motion. It can be done as part of a warm-up or cool-down routine
results: Improves flexibility and posture, reduces the risk of injury, relieves muscle tension, and promotes relaxation and stress relief
reps: Hold for 15-30 seconds per stretch and repeated 2-4 times for each muscle group
